text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from
foodwishes.com with strawberry ice cream
that's right and there's two ways you
can make this you can use the classic
french style egg based custard which is
harder and kind of muddles those
beautiful fruity flavors or you can use
what they call american style ice cream
which does not include an egg custard
which is easier and in my opinion
produces a much cleaner brighter
strawberry flavor so guess which one
we're going to use
wrong we're going to use the second one
so let's go ahead and get started and
the first step is to trim our
strawberries and all that means is trim
off the green leaves at the top by the
way these strawberries have been rinsed
and any small pointy knife is going to
work and i actually have a tool that
does this i believe it's called a
strawberry huller
i said holler but i have no idea where
it is it's probably in the junk drawer
but i can't be bothered to look and as
you'll notice i'm trimming them right
into a blender because once we finish
the next step is we're going to add some
sugar to this
just a little and we're going to take
that over to the blender and we're going
to go ahead and pulse that on and off
till it gets going and then we'll just
blend that for a few seconds until those
strawberries are pureed and once that's
been accomplished what i like to do is
just let it sit there for about 10
minutes i believe that sugar is pulling
out water from all those little
particles of strawberry and i think by
letting it sit for a few minutes here it
does something i'm not quite sure what i
call this intuitive science and that it
feels like it does something but anyway
i'm gonna let mine sit for 10 minutes
and then we'll go ahead and add the rest
of the ingredients
which includes a pinch of salt and this
is important don't skip this all right i
don't care if you think it's weird
you're weird if you don't put it in so a
few grains of salt we're also going to
add a spoon of pure vanilla extract and
please do not substitute with impure
extract it's not as good so use the real
stuff and then that brings us to the
dairy portion of the program
and we're going to use two kinds i'm
going to use some whole milk
and some heavy cream
and basically twice as much heavy cream
as milk that's just my favorite
particular blend and then speaking of
blend i'm just going to give this a very
very brief blending about 10-15 seconds
and in addition to mixing all the
ingredients
it's going to thicken up our cream just
ever so slightly and i'm going to talk
about this in the post so go read that
you can totally screw up the whole
recipe by over mixing it here because
that could turn into whipped cream and
that's not what we want so just a very
brief blending and as you'll see like i
said it's going to thicken up just ever
so slightly which you will be able to
witness as i stir in the next ingredient
which for me was two drops of all
natural vegetable vegetable-based red
dye oh don't be afraid totally safe this
is not that toxic stuff our parents used
to love but anyway that is optional if
you don't want it don't put it you are
the sid bream of your ice cream and i'm
going to go ahead and stir that in which
is going to give that final product just
one degree darker shade of pink and
right here you can see what i was
talking about that mixture has a little
bit of thickness to it but it's not
whipped and at that point i think we're
ready to break out the ice cream maker
and i'm gonna use your standard
countertop style
it's a one and a half quart size bowl
that you keep in the freezer
that goes on the base the little
churning paddle goes inside
and then this clear cover goes over that
very simple machine
and we'll turn that on and that's it and
once we have that put together and
spinning let's go ahead and pour in our
ice cream base
and by the way the amounts here give or
take a strawberry should fill this up
all the way to the top
in fact to be honest i couldn't get the
last couple tablespoons in so that's why
you see me eating a little bit here so i
could fit the rest in hey what was i
supposed to do
but anyway once that mixture's in you
don't have much to do except stand there
and wait for 15 or 20 minutes until it
thickens oh and one good tip when this
is finished churning we got to move very
quickly
all right so go ahead and find your
container you're going to keep this in
ahead of time but anyway we're going to
let that churn and of course because i'm
a very conscientious chef i like to do
quality control checks throughout the
process and besides sneaking bites it's
kind of cool to watch you go through all
the phases from liquid to this year
which would resemble something like a
thick milkshake which by the way if you
stop right here and pour this in the
glasses you'll be enjoying like the best
strawberry milkshake ever but try to
resist let it go and eventually you're
going to see it thicken up
and that top's going to get way more
three-dimensional and it should be noted
these type of ice cream makers are not
going to turn the ice cream all the way
solid but it will get plenty thick
enough for us to freeze without it
crystallizing which for me was right
about here
and as soon as we decide we've gone far
enough we're going to take that top off
and you have to move quickly we have to
get this into the freezer as soon as
possible so whatever you do do not stop
to take another bite you're just wasting
time okay so do not do that so like i
said we're gonna move quickly we're
gonna scrape it off that churning paddle
and of course transfer the rest in
and as soon as you get it in there and
even it out i want you to throw down a
piece of plastic press it right down to
the surface and then we'll cover that
throw it immediately into the freezer
until it freezes solid at least two or
three hours okay so feel free to make
this the night before you want to eat it
but once it's frozen we're going to go
ahead and pull it out take off the
plastic
and give it the first official taste but
a couple things to keep in mind because
we did not use one of those thicker
egg-based custards and because
strawberries are almost all water which
means of course this ice cream base has
a lot of water in it because of those
two reasons you're really not going to
get that same thick luxurious texture
that you will with some other styles but
the path is besides being easier is that
you really do get a much purer much
stronger much more vibrant and fresh
strawberry flavor so that's the main
reason i prefer this style so let's go
ahead and serve some up and i think we
should go ahead and garnish with a whole
berry it's going to make that gorgeous
pink look even nicer and that's it
homemade strawberry ice cream and as i
dig in here i should clarify when i
mentioned earlier about the textural
differences that's mostly an appearance
and kind of how it feels on the spoon
but on the palette this is actually
quite smooth quite rich and as i
mentioned already has the taste of pure
strawberries and cream just an
incredible frozen treat and for me one
of the quintessential experiences of
summer so i really hope you give this a
try head over to foodwishes.com for all
the ingredient amounts and more info as
usual and as always enjoy
[Music]
you
